bropals.lib.simplegame.state

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.state.GameState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EntityState, TestState

    public abstract class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that is meant to hold code for a state in the game. Extend the class and implement all the code for that state of the game. To run the game state,

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AssetManager getAssetManager()
      Returns a reference to the AssetBank used by the GameStateRunner that is running this GameState.
      GameStateRunner getGameStateRunner()
      Returns a reference to the GameStateRunner running this game state.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(java.lang.String key)
      Gets the image with the specified key from this GameState's AssetBank.
      GameWindow getWindow()
      Returns a reference to the GameWindow used by the GameStateRunner that is running this GameState.

      Called when the game gets key input.
      abstract void mouse(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e, boolean pressed)
      Called when the game gets mouse button input.
      abstract void onEnter()
      The method called when this game state is first set.
      abstract void onExit()
      The method called when this game state is being swapped with a different game state.

      Convenience method for playing a sound effect from this GameState's AssetBank.

      Render the game state to an Object.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the image with the specified key from this GameState's AssetBank. This is the same thing as doing getAssetManager().getAsset(key, BufferedImage.class)
        Parameters:
        key - the image key
        Returns:
        the image with the given key if it exists.

      • playSoundEffect

        public void playSoundEffect(java.lang.String key)
        Convenience method for playing a sound effect from this GameState's AssetBank. This is the same as doing getAssetManager().getAsset(key, SoundEffect.class).play()
        Parameters:
        key -

      • key

        public abstract void key(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e,
       boolean pressed)
        Called when the game gets key input.
        Parameters:
        e - the key event.
        pressed - whether or not the key was pressed or released. true for pressed, false for released.

      • mouse

        public abstract void mouse(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e,
         boolean pressed)
        Called when the game gets mouse button input.
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event.
        pressed - whether or not the mouse button was pressed or released. true for pressed, false for released.
